text:
Setup
1.Java servlet file has a static method
2.JSP accesses the static method

Steps
1.Change the method signature in java,jsp files
2.Reload the webapp from Tomcat Manager
3.Access the jsp page 

throws MethodNotDefined Exception

Expected - JSP page is displayed/processed.
creator: callbabusats@hotmail.com
markt@apache.org
text:
Your steps do not include re-compiling the servlet java file to a class file 
(something Jasper will not do for you). Therefore a MethodNotDefined exception 
is entirely expected when Jasper attempts to recompile the JSP.

creator: callbabusats@yahoo.co.in
text:
Sorry,I missed that step in defect report.
Java servlet file,is compiled and put into WEB-INF\classes by IDE.

Then i reload the servlet.
The new changes are effective.

Only jasper fails.

Just tested this with Eclipse with the MyEclipse plug-in.

This works as expected. For info I noted the following:
Just replacing the class file has no effect
(the servlet has already been loaded)

Then updating the JSP causes the exception
(the servlet still has the old signature and the JSP is trying to use the new 
one)

Reloading the webapp through the manager fixes the error
(both the servlet and the JSP refer to the new signature)
creator: markt@apache.org

text:
Are you using Tomcat 5 in myeclipse plugin?
It occurs in my setup in Tomcat 4 without myeclipse plugin.
creator: callbabusats@yahoo.co.in
markt@apache.org
text:
This was tested against tomcat 4 as that is what you reported the bug against.

This works for me whether I use the MyEclipse plug-in or not. There is clearly 
no tomcat bug here. Possible causes of the problem you are seeing include:
- user error
- configuration error
- IDE bug

Please do not re-open this report. If you require further assistance please 
use the tomcat-user mailing list.
